Overview   Package  Class  Use  Tree  Deprecated  Index  Help

Package org.bluez.v3

Interface Summary
Adapter The "Adapter" interface provides methods to setup the local adapter(s), search remote devices, pairing and search for services.
AuthorizationAgent Service unique name;
Database SDP queries involves transactions between an SDP server and an SDP client.
Manager This interface provides methods to list the available adapters, retrieve the default local adapter path and list/activate services.
PasskeyAgent Service unique name;
Security pin_helper concept has been removed starting with bluez-utils 3.X.
Service The service interfaces aim provide an easy way to develop Bluetooth services.
 

Class Summary
Adapter.BondingCreated Signals that a successful bonding has been created.
Adapter.BondingRemoved Signals that a bonding was removed.
Adapter.DiscoverableTimeoutChanged After changing the discoverable timeout this signal provide the new timeout value.
Adapter.DiscoveryCompleted This signal indicates that a device discovery procedure has been completed.
Adapter.DiscoveryStarted This signal indicates that a device discovery procedure has been started.
Adapter.MinorClassChanged After changing the minor class with SetMinorClass this signal will provide the new class value.
Adapter.ModeChanged If the current mode is changed with SetMode this signal will inform about the new mode.
Adapter.NameChanged After changing the local adapter name with SetName this signal will provide the new name.
Adapter.PeriodicDiscoveryStarted This signal indicates that a periodic discovery procedure has been started.
Adapter.PeriodicDiscoveryStopped This signal indicates that a periodic discovery procedure has been completed.
Adapter.RemoteAliasChanged After changing an alias with SetRemoteAlias this signal will indicate the new alias.
Adapter.RemoteAliasCleared After removing an alias with ClearRemoteAlias this signal will indicate that the alias is no longer valid.
Adapter.RemoteClassUpdated This signal will be send every time the remote class of device has been changed.
Adapter.RemoteDeviceConnected This signal will be send if a low level connection between two devices has been created.
Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisappeared This signal will be send when an inquiry session for a periodic discovery finishes and previously found devices are no longer in range or visible.
Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisconnected This signal will be send if a low level connection between two devices has been terminated.
Adapter.RemoteDeviceDisconnectRequested This signal will be sent when a low level disconnection to a remote device has been requested.
Adapter.RemoteDeviceFound This signal will be send every time an inquiry result has been found by the service daemon.
Adapter.RemoteIdentifiersUpdated This signal is sent to indicate the provided services of a given remote device.
Adapter.RemoteNameFailed This signal will be sent every time the service daemon tries to resolve a remote and this fails.
Adapter.RemoteNameRequested This signal will be sent every time the service daemon tries to resolve a remote name during discovery.
Adapter.RemoteNameUpdated This signal will be send every time the service daemon detect a new name for a remote device.
Adapter.TrustAdded Sent when SetTrusted() is called.
Adapter.TrustRemoved Sent when RemoveTrust() is called.
BlueZAPIV3 Access BlueZ v3 over D-Bus
Manager.AdapterAdded Parameter is object path of added adapter.
Manager.AdapterRemoved Parameter is object path of removed adapter.
Manager.DefaultAdapterChanged Parameter is object path of the new default adapter.
Manager.ServiceAdded Parameter is object path of registered service agent.
Manager.ServiceRemoved Parameter is object path of unregistered service agent.
Service.Started The object path of this signal contains which service was started.
Service.Stopped The object path of this signal contains which service was stopped.
Service.TrustAdded Sent when SetTrusted() is called.
Service.TrustRemoved Sent when RemoveTrust() is called.
